title: French elections: Majority-less Assemblée Nationale risks being paralyzed
summary: The Assemblée is split into three blocs of comparable size: The left-wing Nouveau Front Populaire (182 MPs), the presidential coalition (168) and the far right (143). This is unprecedented for the French Fifth Republic.

title: Who will govern France? Four questions to understand what happens after the election
summary: Could France be led by a coalition government, minority government or technical government? In the absence of a clear absolute majority in the Assemblée Nationale, there is a risk of deadlock.

title: Macron asks PM Attal to stay on 'for the moment'
summary: Gabriel Attal tendered his resignation after President Emmanuel Macron's coalition lost its majority in the snap elections. But he will stay on as caretaker, with no candidate standing out to replace him immediately.

title: French left to name PM candidate 'this week,' says Socialist leader
summary: While the left-wing coalition won the most seats in the Assemblée Nationale, there is no agreement on who would be prime minister of a left-led government.

title: French elections: Macron avoids debacle and bides time
summary: Against all expectations, the presidential coalition finished ahead of the far right but was beaten by the left. After seven years of a 'top-down' administration, the president will have to deal with his opponents for the first time.

title: The RN's bitterness and denial after the French elections
summary: The far-right party failed to replicate the broad success it achieved in the European elections and in the first round of voting, and is not yet willing to question what cost it its predicted victory.

title: French elections: International media report 'great relief' at the RN being blocked, but 'the situation is far from rosy'
summary: After the second round of France's parliamentary elections, foreign media hailed the success of efforts to block the far right, but feared the 'chaotic situation' that could result from the clear divisions in the Assemblée.

title: Russian missiles strike Ukraine, including Kyiv children's hospital
summary: Russia struck cities across Ukraine on Monday with a missile barrage that killed 37 people and heavily damaged Ukraine's largest children's hospital in the capital. The attack targeted five Ukrainian cities with more than 40 missiles of different types, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky said on social media.

title: The letters from two Ukrainian sisters: 'They say that during a war, women give birth to more boys than girls to compensate for losses. I'm yet another proof of it'
summary: Olga and Sasha Kurovska, two Ukrainian sisters, one of whom lives in Paris and the other in Kyiv, kept a diary for a year in Le Monde. The pair shared a personal account of how their daily lives were disrupted by the war. They now give updates about their lives in the form of regular correspondence.

title: Tokyo's nationalist governor dreams of becoming Japan's prime minister
summary: Widely elected for a third term, Yuriko Koike, who is very much on the right, is outpacing her opponents by promising populist measures. Her success has further consolidated her position in a fragmented political landscape.

title: Jordan Bardella to lead new far-right EU Parliament group
summary: The head of the far-right Rassemblement National will lead the new group comprised of other far-right MEPs, becoming the third-biggest force in the European Parliament.

title: Hurricane Beryl makes landfall in Texas, causes over 3 million to lose power
summary: Beryl hit Texas on Monday, causing heavy rain, powerful winds and power outages for over 3 million households. So far, there have been at least three people killed, according to officials.

title: European stocks drop after French snap election
summary: No bloc won an outright majority in the second round of France's parliamentary elections on Sunday, plunging the country into political uncertainty unprecedented in its recent history.

title: Farewell, avocado and chocolate! Chefs are now embracing eco-responsibility
summary: Herring instead of eel at David Toutain's, chicory instead of coffee at Florent Ladeyn's – some chefs are no longer hesitant about forgoing ingredients that are problematic for the environment.

title: French airport worker unions call for strike week before Paris Olympics
summary: Several unions have called for a strike on July 17, nine days before the start of the Paris Games, over a dispute about staff bonuses during the Olympics.

title: Inside the secrets of generative AI
summary: The Franco-American startup Hugging Face recently made the most powerful corpus of texts for developing language models available on its open-source platform.

title: French elections: Netanyahu ally representing French abroad defeated
summary: Right-wing MP Meyer Habib, whose constituency encompasses several countries around the Mediterranean, including Israel, Italy, Greece and Turkey, received 47.3% of the vote, behind presidential coalition candidate Caroline Yadan, who won with 52.7%.

title: French elections: LFI dissenter François Ruffin narrowly re-elected
summary: Ruffin, who fell out with Jean-Luc Mélenchon and the La France Insoumise party during the campaign, was elected with 51.21% of the vote in a tough contest against the far right.

title: French elections: Former president François Hollande elected to Parliament
summary: Hollande, who had been president when Macron emerged onto France's political scene, won a majority of votes cast in his constituency, running against both the far-right Rassemblement National candidate and incumbent right-wing MP Francis Dubois.

title: NATO allies pledge long-term support for Ukraine, but stop short of membership
summary: The Alliance's 32 members are set to strengthen support for Ukraine's air defense systems at the Washington summit from July 9 to 11, but the prospect of membership remains out of reach.

title: A politically charged South American presence at the Festival d'Avignon
summary: One-third of the theater festival's program will be performed in Spanish and will feature the works of Tamara Cubas, Tiziano Cruz and Malicho Vaca Valenzuela who explore the history and aesthetics of the body.

title: At the Paris Olympics, Ukrainian athletes are seeking far more than a medal
summary: Ukrainian hurdler Anna's goal is not just gold, but also to rivet global attention on her country’s fight for survival against Russia: 'You’re not doing it for yourself anymore.'

title: 2024 French elections: Map and chart of results
summary: French voters returned to the polls on Sunday, July 7, to elect a new Assemblée Nationale and determine who will be in a position to govern France. See how many seats each party won and the district-by-district map.

title: Age, gender, profession: Who are France's new members of Parliament?
summary: Only 208 women will sit in the Assemblée Nationale, representing just over a third of all MPs. This is the second time in two years that the proportion of women in the Assemblée has fallen.

title: Keir Starmer jets off to Washington on first foreign trip as UK Prime Minister
summary: Starmer, 61, will attend NATO's 75th anniversary summit in the US capital on his debut foreign trip since becoming British leader last Friday, July 5.

title: French elections: Left-wing alliance comes out on top in unprecedented political landscape
summary: Having won the most seats, the Nouveau Front Populaire now faces the challenge of negotiating with other political forces in order to convert its first place into a governing majority.

title: French elections: 'Far from the expected 'clarification,' the results plunge country into uncertainty'
summary: With the Assemblée Nationale split into three blocs and none being in a dominant position, the French president has regained leeway where he could have lost it all. Yet he inflicted hardship on the country, writes political columnist Solenn de Royer.

title: French elections: Macron is in search of an elusive coalition
summary: The French president was hoping for 'clarification' after the parliamentary elections. The absence of a majority makes the current situation even more complex.

title: Ukraine reels after one of Russia's deadliest air attacks
summary: On July 8, military and civilian targets across Ukraine were destroyed by Russian missiles, killing at least 41 people. These attacks reveal the deterioration of Ukraine's air defense.

title: Europe's Ariane-6 rocket on track for its first launch
summary: European Space Agency's Ariane-6 is scheduled to take off from Kourou, in French Guiana on Tuesday, July 9. This maiden flight should enable Europeans to find their way back into space.

title: Two French rugby players detained in Argentina over alleged sex assault
summary: Hugo Auradou and Oscar Jégou, who played in France's Test victory over Argentina on Saturday, will be taken to Mendoza where the alleged attack took place.

title: Euro 2024: So far, Mbappé leads France with his head but not his performance
summary: Despite being physically weakened, the star striker of the French national team is mentally holding on and fully committed to playing his role as captain in the semi-final match against Spain on Tuesday at 9 pm.

title: French investigators probe Le Pen's 2022 campaign finances
summary: The investigation is looking into allegations of embezzlement, forgery, fraud, and that a candidate on an electoral campaign accepted a loan, the Paris prosecutor's office said.

title: French elections: 'In our system, political logic prevails when it comes to naming a prime minister'
summary: Julien Boudon, a professor of public law and expert on the French Constitution, details President Emmanuel Macron's leeway given the composition of the new Assemblée Nationale.

title: Short of Wembanyama, Les Bleus lose to Germany in Olympic warm-up match
summary: Without their prodigy, who had to withdraw due to a 'viral illness,' Les Bleus lost to the Germans (65-70). It was a disappointing defeat 18 days before their Olympic debut.
